news.title: ‘I hope one day you can forgive me’ – man who filmed himself stabbing wife to death addresses court as he’s jailed for life
news.summary: A father of two who inadvertently recorded the moment he stabbed his wife to death told gardaí at the scene that she was having an affair and that he "freaked out" after seeing "something on her phone about sex", a court has heard.

news.title: ‘Lovely, quiet man’ killed in Cork house fire named as master brewer Peter Lyall (62)
news.summary: Tributes have been paid to a respected master brewer who died in a Cork fire.

news.title: Pat Spillane: One All-Ireland medal so far is underwhelming for the greatest player of all time
news.summary: The ingredients were all there for a brilliant match between Donegal and Meath in the All-Ireland semi-final.

news.title: Jason Willick: Trump now risks being impaled on Epstein conspiracy hook he helped bait
news.summary: Some political frauds have a rational endgame.

news.title: Cork cancel All-Ireland homecoming in the wake of calamitous final implosion
news.summary: Cork GAA has cancelled plans for an official homecoming in the aftermath of Sunday’s calamitous All-Ireland hurling final collapse.

news.title: Meet Steve Cavanagh, the Belfast human rights lawyer who became a  crime writing bestseller
news.summary: Crime novelist Steve Cavanagh admits his search history throws up a fairly terrifying mix, with things like “how to bypass a security system” and “faking a time of death”

news.title: ‘Very difficult’ travel conditions and some homes without power after torrential rain
news.summary: Met Éireann is warning of very heavy rain, thunder and widespread flooding in several counties on Monday.

news.title: Ciara Kelly: The softer society is on drugs, the more mainstream they become. We should be debating the merits of liberal attitudes
news.summary: There was some very interesting research out last week on our attitudes to drug use from Merchants Quay Ireland. The toplines for me were that while there’s still some stigma attached to drugs, we’re far more tolerant of them now than we were in 2000.

news.title: ‘An easy fix’ – tattoo artist offers to change digit in Cork fan’s premature ink
news.summary: A hurling fan who got an 'All-Ireland Champions 2025' tattoo days before Cork were humbled by Tipperary at Croke Park has been offered the chance to change a digit as a vote of future confidence in his beloved Rebels.

news.title: Limerick killer spent €100,000 on ‘grandiose’ renovations to family home, court told
news.summary: A convicted killer previously jailed for “feud related” offences, who has never had a job, spent €100,000 carrying out “grandiose” renovations on his family home in Limerick, a court has heard.
